original_title: IMF will not get involved in domestic debt reworking
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The International Monetary Fund on Monday (15) stressed that it would NOT get involved in Sri Lanka's domestic debt restructuring process.
Krishna Srinivasan, the Director of Asia and Pacific Department of the IMF said "We don't get involved in any of the debt restructuring negotiations, defining the parameter of debt and so on."
He noted that the authorities are making good faith efforts of negotiating with all the creditors, both private creditors and official creditors, and the engagement is going on quite well.

"In terms of the timeline it is the expectation that the restructuring exercises will be completed by the first review of the program which is in September and October," said Krishna Srinivasan, the Director of Asia and Pacific Department of the IMF.
